info.title: GeoWave API
info.description: REST API for GeoWave CLI commands

parameters.name: parameters
parameters.description: [storename]

parameters.name: mapReduceConfigFile
parameters.description: MapReduce Configuration

parameters.name: mapReduceHdfsBaseDir
parameters.description: Fully qualified path to the base directory in hdfs

parameters.name: mapReduceHdfsHostPort
parameters.description: HDFS hostname and port in the format hostname:port

parameters.name: mapReduceJobtrackerHostPort
parameters.description: [REQUIRED (or resourceman)] Hadoop job tracker hostname and port in the format hostname:port

parameters.name: mapReduceYarnResourceManager
parameters.description: [REQUIRED (or jobtracker)] Yarn resource manager hostname and port in the format hostname:port

parameters.name: commonDistanceFunctionClass
parameters.description: Distance Function Class implements mil.nga.giat.geowave.analytics.distance.DistanceFn

parameters.name: authorizations
parameters.description: The comma-separated list of authorizations used during extract; by default all authorizations are used.

parameters.name: adapterIds
parameters.description: The comma-separated list of data adapters to query; by default all adapters are used.

parameters.name: indexId
parameters.description: The specific index to query; by default one is chosen for each adapter.

parameters.name: extractMaxInputSplit
parameters.description: Maximum hdfs input split size

parameters.name: extractMinInputSplit
parameters.description: Minimum hdfs input split size

parameters.name: extractQuery
parameters.description: Query

parameters.name: outputOutputFormat
parameters.description: Output Format Class

parameters.name: outputReducerCount
parameters.description: Number of Reducers For Output

parameters.name: outputHdfsOutputPath
parameters.description: Output HDFS File Path

parameters.name: partitioningDistanceThresholds
parameters.description: Comma separated list of distance thresholds, per dimension

parameters.name: partitioningGeometricDistanceUnit
parameters.description: Geometric distance unit (m=meters,km=kilometers, see symbols for javax.units.BaseUnit)

parameters.name: clusteringMaxIterations
parameters.description: Maximum number of iterations when finding optimal clusters

parameters.name: clusteringMinimumSize
parameters.description: Minimum Cluster Size

parameters.name: globalBatchId
parameters.description: Batch ID

parameters.name: hullDataTypeId
parameters.description: Data Type ID for a centroid item

parameters.name: hullProjectionClass
parameters.description: Class to project on to 2D space. Implements mil.nga.giat.geowave.analytics.tools.Projection

parameters.name: outputDataNamespaceUri
parameters.description: Output namespace for objects that will be written to GeoWave

parameters.name: outputDataTypeId
parameters.description: Output Data ID assigned to objects that will be written to GeoWave

parameters.name: outputIndexId
parameters.description: Output Index ID for objects that will be written to GeoWave

parameters.name: partitionMaxMemberSelection
parameters.description: Maximum number of members selected from a partition

parameters.name: partitionPartitionerClass
parameters.description: Index Identifier for Centroids

parameters.name: partitionPartitionDecreaseRate
parameters.description: Rate of decrease for precision(within (0,1])

parameters.name: partitionMaxDistance
parameters.description: Maximum Partition Distance

parameters.name: partitionPartitionPrecision
parameters.description: Partition Precision

parameters.name: partitionSecondaryPartitionerClass
parameters.description: Perform secondary partitioning with the provided class

post.description: Configure an index for usage in GeoWave

parameters.name: parameters
parameters.description: [name]

parameters.name: makeDefault
parameters.description: Make this the default index creating stores

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: The type of index, such as spatial, or spatial_temporal

parameters.name: nameOverride
parameters.description: A custom name can be given to this index. Default name will be the based on configuration parameters.

parameters.name: numPartitions
parameters.description: The number of partitions.  Default partitions will be 1.

parameters.name: partitionStrategy
parameters.description: The partition strategy to use.  Default will be none.

post.description: Create an index group for usage in GeoWave

parameters.name: parameters
parameters.description: [name] [comma separated list of indexes]

parameters.name: parameters
parameters.description: [name]

parameters.name: makeDefault
parameters.description: Make this the default store in all operations

parameters.name: zookeeper
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of zookeeper servers that an Accumulo instance is using

parameters.name: instance
parameters.description: The Accumulo instance ID

parameters.name: user
parameters.description: A valid Accumulo user ID

parameters.name: password
parameters.description: The password for the user. Can be specified as 'pass:[password]', 'file:[local file containing the password]', 'propfile:[local properties file containing the password]:[property file key]', 'env:[variable containing the pass]', or stdin

parameters.name: geowaveNamespace
parameters.description: The geowave namespace (optional; default is no namespace)

parameters.name: parameters
parameters.description: [name]

parameters.name: makeDefault
parameters.description: Make this the default store in all operations

parameters.name: geowaveNamespace
parameters.description: The geowave namespace (optional; default is no namespace)

parameters.name: parameters
parameters.description: [name]

parameters.name: makeDefault
parameters.description: Make this the default store in all operations

parameters.name: zookeeper
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of zookeeper servers that an HBase instance is using

parameters.name: disableServiceSide
parameters.description: Disable all custom GeoWave server side processing, to include coprocessors and custom filters.  This will alleviate the requirement to have a GeoWave jar on HBase's region server classpath.

parameters.name: coprocessorJar
parameters.description: Path (HDFS URL) to the jar containing coprocessor classes

parameters.name: geowaveNamespace
parameters.description: The geowave namespace (optional; default is no namespace)

parameters.name: makeDefault

parameters.name: nameOverride

parameters.name: numPartitions

post.description: Copy and modify existing store configuration

parameters.name: parameters

parameters.name: makeDefault

parameters.name: geowaveNamespace
parameters.description: The geowave namespace (optional; default is no namespace)

post.description: Create a local configuration for GeoServer

parameters.name: username
parameters.description: GeoServer User

parameters.name: pass
parameters.description: GeoServer Password - Can be specified as 'pass:[password]', 'file:[local file containing the password]', 'propfile:[local properties file containing the password]:[property file key]', 'env:[variable containing the pass]', or stdin

parameters.name: workspace
parameters.description: GeoServer Default Workspace

parameters.name: parameters
parameters.description: GeoServer URL (for example http://localhost:8080/geoserver or https://localhost:8443/geoserver), or simply host:port and appropriate assumptions are made

parameters.name: sslSecurityProtocol
parameters.description: Specify the Transport Layer Security (TLS) protocol to use when connecting to the server. By default, the system will use TLS.

parameters.name: sslTrustStorePath
parameters.description: Specify the absolute path to where truststore file is located on system. The truststore file is used to validate client certificates.

parameters.name: sslTrustStorePassword
parameters.description: Specify the password to use to access the truststore file. - Can be specified as 'pass:[password]', 'file:[local file containing the password]', 'propfile:[local properties file containing the password]:[property file key]', 'env:[variable containing the pass]', or stdin

parameters.name: sslTrustStoreType
parameters.description: Specify the type of key store used for the truststore, i.e. JKS (Java KeyStore).

parameters.name: sslTrustStoreProvider
parameters.description: Specify the name of the truststore provider to be used for the server certificate.

parameters.name: sslTrustManagerAlgorithm
parameters.description: Specify the algorithm to use for the truststore.

parameters.name: sslTrustManagerProvider
parameters.description: Specify the trust manager factory provider.

parameters.name: sslKeyStorePath
parameters.description: Specify the absolute path to where the keystore file is located on system. The keystore contains the server certificate to be loaded.

parameters.name: sslKeyStorePassword
parameters.description: Specify the password to use to access the keystore file. - Can be specified as 'pass:[password]', 'file:[local file containing the password]', 'propfile:[local properties file containing the password]:[property file key]', 'env:[variable containing the pass]', or stdin

parameters.name: sslKeyStoreProvider
parameters.description: Specify the name of the keystore provider to be used for the server certificate.

parameters.name: sslKeyPassword
parameters.description: Specify the password to be used to access the server certificate from the specified keystore file. - Can be specified as 'pass:[password]', 'file:[local file containing the password]', 'propfile:[local properties file containing the password]:[property file key]', 'env:[variable containing the pass]', or stdin

parameters.name: sslKeyStoreType
parameters.description: The type of keystore file to be used for the server certificate.

parameters.name: sslKeyManagerAlgorithm
parameters.description: Specify the algorithm to use for the keystore.

parameters.name: sslKeyManagerProvider
parameters.description: Specify the key manager factory provider.

parameters.description: [coverage store name]

parameters.name: equalizeHistogramOverride
parameters.description: This parameter will override the behavior to always perform histogram equalization if a histogram exists.  Valid values are true and false.

parameters.name: interpolationOverride
parameters.description: This will override the default interpolation stored for each layer.  Valid values are 0, 1, 2, 3 for NearestNeighbor, Bilinear, Bicubic, and Bicubic (polynomial variant) resepctively.

parameters.name: scaleTo8Bit
parameters.description: By default, integer values will automatically be scaled to 8-bit and floating point values will not.  This can be overridden setting this value to true or false.

post.description: Subscribe to a Kafka topic and ingest into GeoWave

parameters.name: parameters
parameters.description: [store name] [comma delimited index/group list]

parameters.name: visibility
parameters.description: The visibility of the data ingested (optional; default is 'public')

parameters.name: groupId
parameters.description: A string that uniquely identifies the group of consumer processes to which this consumer belongs. By setting the same group id multiple processes indicate that they are all part of the same consumer group.

parameters.name: zookeeperConnect
parameters.description: Specifies the ZooKeeper connection string in the form hostname:port where host and port are the host and port of a ZooKeeper server. To allow connecting through other ZooKeeper nodes when that ZooKeeper machine is down you can also specify multiple hosts in the form hostname1:port1,hostname2:port2,hostname3:port3.

parameters.name: autoOffsetReset
parameters.description:
What to do when there is no initial offset in ZooKeeper or if an offset is out of range:
	* smallest : automatically reset the offset to the smallest offset
	* largest : automatically reset the offset to the largest offset
	* anything else: throw exception to the consumer

parameters.name: fetchMessageMaxBytes
parameters.description: The number of bytes of messages to attempt to fetch for each topic-partition in each fetch request. These bytes will be read into memory for each partition, so this helps control the memory used by the consumer. The fetch request size must be at least as large as the maximum message size the server allows or else it is possible for the producer to send messages larger than the consumer can fetch.

parameters.name: consumerTimeoutMs
parameters.description: By default, this value is -1 and a consumer blocks indefinitely if no new message is available for consumption. By setting the value to a positive integer, a timeout exception is thrown to the consumer if no message is available for consumption after the specified timeout value.

parameters.name: reconnectOnTimeout
parameters.description: This flag will flush when the consumer timeout occurs (based on kafka property 'consumer.timeout.ms') and immediately reconnect

parameters.name: batchSize
parameters.description: The data will automatically flush after this number of entries

parameters.name: kafkaPropertyFile
parameters.description: Properties file containing Kafka properties

parameters.name: extensions
parameters.description: individual or comma-delimited set of file extensions to accept (optional)

parameters.name: formats
parameters.description: Explicitly set the ingest formats by name (or multiple comma-delimited formats), if not set all available ingest formats will be used

post.description: List supported data store types, index types, and ingest formats
Ingest supported files in local file system directly, without using HDFS

parameters.name: parameters
parameters.description: [file or directory] [storename] [comma delimited index/group list]

parameters.name: visibility
parameters.description: The visibility of the data ingested (optional; default is 'public')

parameters.name: extensions
parameters.description: individual or comma-delimited set of file extensions to accept (optional)

parameters.name: formats
parameters.description: Explicitly set the ingest formats by name (or multiple comma-delimited formats), if not set all available ingest formats will be used

parameters.name: threads
parameters.description: number of threads to use for ingest, default to 1 (optional)

post.description: Stage supported files in local file system to HDFS

parameters.name: parameters
parameters.description: [file or directory] [hdfs host:port] [path to base directory to write to]

parameters.name: extensions
parameters.description: individual or comma-delimited set of file extensions to accept (optional)

parameters.name: formats
parameters.description: Explicitly set the ingest formats by name (or multiple comma-delimited formats), if not set all available ingest formats will be used

post.description: Stage supported files in local file system to a Kafka topic

parameters.name: parameters
parameters.description: [file or directory]

parameters.name: metadataBrokerList
parameters.description: This is for bootstrapping and the producer will only use it for getting metadata (topics, partitions and replicas). The socket connections for sending the actual data will be established based on the broker information returned in the metadata. The format is host1:port1,host2:port2, and the list can be a subset of brokers or a VIP pointing to a subset of brokers.

parameters.name: requestRequiredAcks
parameters.description: This value controls when a produce request is considered completed. Specifically, how many other brokers must have committed the data to their log and acknowledged this to the leader?

parameters.name: producerType
parameters.description: This parameter specifies whether the messages are sent asynchronously in a background thread. Valid values are (1) async for asynchronous send and (2) sync for synchronous send. By setting the producer to async we allow batching together of requests (which is great for throughput) but open the possibility of a failure of the client machine dropping unsent data.

parameters.name: serializerClass
parameters.description: The serializer class for messages. The default encoder takes a byte[] and returns the same byte[].

parameters.name: retryBackoffMs
parameters.description: The amount of time to wait before attempting to retry a failed produce request to a given topic partition. This avoids repeated sending-and-failing in a tight loop.

parameters.name: kafkaPropertyFile
parameters.description: Properties file containing Kafka properties

parameters.name: extensions
parameters.description: individual or comma-delimited set of file extensions to accept (optional)

parameters.name: formats
parameters.description: Explicitly set the ingest formats by name (or multiple comma-delimited formats), if not set all available ingest formats will be used
